newsitem.title: USA: Avon, Mattel to launch Barbie cosmetics.
newsitem.headline: Avon, Mattel to launch Barbie cosmetics.

text.p: Avon Products Inc said on Thursday it agreed to market Mattel Inc's Barbie dolls and other products in the United States and a new line of Barbie cosmetics worldwide, in an expanded alliance expected to boost Avon's net sales by $100 million annually.

Avon and Mattel first came together last year when Avon sales representatives marketed Barbie dolls designed for Avon by Mattel. The dolls were Avon's best-selling gift product ever, generating $40 million in sales, the company said.
Later this year, Avon will again market Barbies made specially for it by Mattel.
But Avon also will market a broader range of Mattel products through its direct sales channel, including Disney, Sesame Street and Cabbage Patch characters.
The companies also said they will launch a global line of licensed Barbie cosmetics, fragrance and toiletry products.
The line will be launched in the fourth quarter in the United States, Canada and certain Latin American markets, with markets in Europe and Asia under active consideration.
Mattel chief executive Jill Barad said in a statement that her company looked forward to working with Avon in such overseas markets as China.
